entry.title: Setting - 'Disable cache (while DevTools is open)' is not respected, cache is always disabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 122.0.6261.69 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: M122 Rollout) OS: Windows 11 Enterprise 22H2
What steps will reproduce the problem?
- Open DevTools (network panel) - Observe 'disable cache' option checked by default - Open settings - Uncheck option 'Disable cache (while DevTools is open) - Close settings - Uncheck 'disable cache' in network panel - Reload page
What is the expected result? The page should reload with cache enabled.
What happens instead? The page reloads with cache disabled. The box rechecks itself regardless of choice in settings.

entry.title: `text-spacing-trim: normal` trims the line-start in some cases
entry.content:
Split from https://crbug.com/40275400#comment65 Test case: https://murakamishinyu.github.io/bugtest/chromebugs/text-spacing-trim.html ```html

「あああ」、「あああ」「あああ」、「あああ」「あああ」、「あああ」「あああ」ああああ「ああああ、あああああああ。」

``` The expected result is as follows: ```  ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣   ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣   ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣   ｢あああ｣ ああああ  ｢ああああ､ ああああ あああ｡｣  ``` But the actual result is as follows: ```  ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣   ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣  ｢あああ｣､ ｢あああ｣  ｢あああ｣ ああああ  ｢ああああ､ ああああ あああ｡｣  ``` It seems that the opening punctuation at line start is trimmed wrongly just after a closing punctuation at line end after an inline element that changes font settings (in this case, ``).

entry.title: MDM managed device doesn't apply all policies
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. install windows 10 iot enterprise ltsc in virtual machine 2. enroll to mdm 3. install chrome enterprise via msi bundle 4. set policy that are only available on instances managed via MDM (or Active Directory), for example NewTabPageLocation or MetricsReportingEnabled 5. go to chrome://policy/ and see status "This policy is blocked, its value will be ignored."
# Problem Description as far as i could understand, this behavior is caused by incorrect OS version detection and this bug has been fixed in Microsoft Edge (which is also chromium based browser)
https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/enterprise/bug-windows-10-pro-education-this-policy-is-blocked-its-value/m-p/3273885/highlight/true#M4408
# Summary MDM managed device doesn't apply all policies
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: No Bluetooth Auto Connect Options
entry.content:
Bluetooth automatically switches to most recent device in range. Most of us have multiple devices connected. Many of these devices are used by multiple devices or multiple people. There needs to be options for each Bluetooth device for Auto-Connect. 1) It can be Auto or Manual. 2) There should be a way to classify device priority for Auto-Connect. 1 device for number 1 priority. If this device is connected or is detected, then it will either remain active or auto connect and switch. If number 2 not available, then follow hierarchy. 3) when devices appear/disconnect, follow rules above. 4) if you manually disconnect a higher priority device, then phone wont connect until device is manually connected or view as "New Device in range"
Situation: - Earbuds/headset paired to both PC and Phone. - Portable speaker shared with spouse - Vehicle connected to multiple family members.
Issues: Each time a previously paired device appears to the phone or other handheld device, connection switches the active device. - I am on a conference call and enter a vehicle, the audio switches to vehicle. I turn off headset and then back on, it returns to headset. - I am listening to a speaker and my wife comes home, the speaker switches to her phone. - I am on a conference call and phone takes over headset - I get into vehicle and both my son's phone and mine are connected. Vehicle connects to whichever it sees first.

entry.title: The iOS ShareExtensionItemReceiver only creates local bookmarks
entry.content:
Starting with rollouts in 2023Q4 where sync was deprecated on iOS in favor of signing-gated, account bookmarks, it looks like ShareExtensionItemReceiver saves bookmarks locally only.
Upon chat with olivierrobin@, we concluded that this is an accidental bug and something better should be implemented.
One way to do this would be to integrate with the notion of default folder in https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ios/chrome/browser/bookmarks/model/bookmarks_utils.h;l=65;drc=8ab223023c1332499835f9b54d6ca8dadad5201c

entry.title: CSS changing when opening dev tools
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 122.0.6261.70 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable Installs & Version Pins) OS : Windows 11 Version 22H2 (Build 22621.3155)
When debugging a Spring Boot application, looks like CSS styles are being loaded correctly when I open a page, but if I open the dev tools in that page it automatically swaps the CSS to an old/cached version, even despite having cache disabled. It doesn't make any sense.
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Load page 2) Open dev tools
What is the expected result? Opening the dev tools shouldn't get cached/old/invalid CSS styles,
What happens instead? Cached CSS styles are retrieved, even when disabling cache.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Closing a WebTransport stream can cause unsent messages to be dropped
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Start a WebTransport echo server - e.g. https://github.com/achingbrain/webtransport-echo-server 2. Copy/paste the `transport` variable setup code into this demo - https://codepen.io/achingbrain/pen/eYXqyYP 3. See the number of received chunks reported in the console
If all messages were sent, it should say:
"done send and read" 1024 "of" 1024
..but it is usually a much smaller number, e.g.:
"done send and read" 77 "of" 1024
# Problem Description Section 13.4 of the WebTransport spec has several examples of how to open a stream, send some data and then close the stream. At no point in the examples do they wait for the data to be sent, instead they just `.write(..)` into the writable writer and `.close()` when all the data has been written.
Reading the other end of the stream shows that not all messages are received when this happens. If you put an arbitrary delay in before closing the stream, assuming the delay is long enough, all messages will be received.
Is this expected behaviour or is this a bug? Should the application layer be ensuring all messages have been received before closing the stream instead?
# Additional Comments I can't select "WebTransport" as a component. I haven't been able to test this in Firefox because their support for `serverCertificateHashes` hasn't landed in nightly yet.
# Summary Closing a WebTransport stream can cause unsent messages to be dropped
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: LCP hack: Base64-encode transparent SVGs that take up most of viewport
entry.content: # Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to https://www.interflora.fr/ 2. Log LCP candidates to console # Problem Description Currently, a base64-encoded transparent SVG taking up most of the viewport (99vw, 99vh) is counted as an LCP candidate when (at least according to the LCP explainer [1] and LCP changelog [2]) it shouldn't be. [1] https://web.dev/articles/lcp#what-elements-are-considered [2] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/speed/metrics_changelog/lcp.md # Additional Comments Here's the markup of the DOM node that is an LCP candidate: ``` ``` ...which looks like this when decoded: ``` ``` # Summary LCP hack: Base64-encode transparent SVGs that take up most of viewport # Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>PerformanceAPIs #### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know # Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Voice over swipe left/right doesn’t have any functionality in password manager edit mode.
entry.content:
App Version: 123.0.6312.15 Beta iOS Version: 16.6, 17.4 Beta 4 Device: iPhones only
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch chrome 2. Go to password manager and add at least one password 3. Turn on device voice over (Go to Device Settings > Accessibility > Voiceover > Turn On) 4. Tap on edit button 5. Swipe or right/left with voice over on
Observed results: Observe that the voice over focus doesn’t shift to the saved passwords instead voice over reads out only the edit button.
Expected results: Voice over focus should shift to the saved passwords or any other available option in the password manager screen
Number of times you were able to reproduce: 5/5 Bug reproducible after clean install: Yes Bug reproducible after clearing cache and cookies: Yes Bug reproducible on Chrome Mobile on Android: Not tested Bug reproducible on Safari/Firefox: Firefox: NA, Safari: NA Bug reproducible on current stable build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes in M122 Bug reproducible on the current beta channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes in M123 Beta Shared Auth bugs: Bug reproducible in SSO1/SSO2 apps? NA Autofill bugs: Bug reproducible on Chrome desktop?NA
Link to video/image: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wWvP5OJEufu3hg8uucBquEXS8y2JecSJ/view?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-GrZaMe7SNMPiyCZnziraKQ

entry.title: Multiple users having issues updating Chrome. Error code 7 - 0X80072EE2 -- System level.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Load up Chrome 2. Try update in About Chrome 3. An error occurred while checking for updates: Update check error: The operation timed out . (error code 7: 0X80072EE2 -- system level).
# Problem Description Multiple users in our environment are experiencing issues updating Chrome recently. This is starting to effect more and more people each day. Chrome will fail to update giving the above error. We can sometimes get Chrome to update if we remove all traces of Chrome from a machine and reinstall the latest version. On the next release it may auto update but then after a few days it will start to error again. We use a proxy.pac file for our proxy and I understand the error is in relation to WININET_E_TIMEOUT but I don't know where else to troubleshoot this from as it was working on my machine for a while and has stopped working today and nothing on our network has changed
# Summary Multiple users having issues updating Chrome. Error code 7 - 0X80072EE2 -- System level.
# Additional Data Category: Installation \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Cleanup: Remove raw_ptr's CtnExperimental
Cleanup: Remove raw_ptr's SetExperimental
entry.content:
This was temporary introduced in the context of rewriting std::set<T*> into std::set<raw_ptr<T>>. This avoided mixing together the automated rewrite, the performance experimental and trialing pointers.
These flags look mysterious for ordinary developers and we should remove them.

entry.title: Chromium always makes requests without providing any attributes or settings
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open example.org 2. Observe errors in the logs. Even Apache docs mention them! https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/en/logs.html
# Problem Description Chromium should understand hints from HTML markup or headers to make or not to make requests.
Chromium should provide settings so that markup isn't necessary. I'm not sure what should take precedence.
# Additional Comments After reading Apache docs and popular SO question https://stackoverflow.com/posts/1321878/revisions.
# Summary Chromium always makes requests without providing any attributes or settings
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: No

entry.title: Cleanup: Remove raw_ptr's VectorExperimental
entry.content:
This was temporary introduced in the context of rewriting std::vector<T*> into std::vector<raw_ptr<T>>. This avoided mixing together the automated rewrite, the performance experimental and trialing pointers.
These flags look mysterious for ordinary developers and we should remove them.

entry.title: Using File System Access API, opening an existing file then save multiple times throws error
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open an existing file(500 MB) from local directory then made some changes then save. Successfully save. 2. open another existing file(same or different with 500 MB or above) from local directory then made some changes then save. Successfully save. 3. open another existing file(same or different with 500 MB or above) from local directory then made some changes then save. Successfully save. 4. On 4th step to open and save throws DomExceptionError
# Problem Description Opening and saving multiple times a file (large sized) throws DOMExceptionError at some time. where as previously the same saved successfully. The exact Error is : DOMException: The requested file could not be read, typically due to permission problems that have occurred after a reference to a file was acquired.
# Summary Using File System Access API, opening an existing file then save multiple times throws error
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: chrome.history.search maxResults only accepts < 32 bit ints
entry.content:
[demo](https://play.web-extensions.dev/#)
Our documentation and error messages say that `maxResults` takes an integer. But it is more restrictive - it only takes numbers up to the positive signed 32 bit int. In Firefox, they take [Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/MAX_SAFE_INTEGER) (2^52)

entry.title: The USB/ HID device logs disappear after a period of inactivity
entry.content:
We recently launched a new program in JP, called the ChromeOS Release Champions, which formalizes ChromeOS Beta channel testing with partners/distributors/oems/odms. This bug is being filed as part of this program due to a report from the partner. Feedback report link: https://listnr.corp.google.com/product/208/report/91561529954
Description #releasechampion-commercial #domain-veolia.com The user noticed the USB/ HID device logs disappear after a period of inactivity, but the docking station and other peripherals connected to it work (shared screen, webcam, audio). After plugging and unplugging the docking station a few times, something appears in (URL: 1) The user is embarrassed because he is developing a Chrome app with chrome.usb and sees the same behavior with this method.
Product description is given in the feedback report: # FeedbackMonLink: https://healthmon.chromeos.goog/feedback/91561529954 open_in_new CHROME VERSION: 122.0.6261.35 beta CHROMEOS_ARC_ANDROID_SDK_VERSION: 33 CHROMEOS_ARC_STATUS: enabled CHROMEOS_AUSERVER: (URL: 4) CHROMEOS_BLUETOOTH_FLOSS: enabled CHROMEOS_RELEASE_BOARD: brya-signed-mp-v14keys CHROMEOS_RELEASE_DESCRIPTION: 15753.24.0 (Official Build) beta-channel brya CHROMEOS_RELEASE_TRACK: beta-channel CHROMEOS_RELEASE_VERSION: 15753.24.0 ENTERPRISE_ENROLLED: Managed hardware_class: ANAHERA-TYOO C5Q-B3J-G4F-673-U2F-B8E-A5W
Additional details can be found in the feedback link provided above.

entry.title: Make the storage access API work when WebView 3PCs are disabled
entry.content:
WebView gates 3PC access through our own [restricted cookie manager proxy](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:android_webview/browser/network_service/aw_proxying_restricted_cookie_manager.h). If 3PCs are disabled, it just doesn't bother sending the response to the restricted cookie manager which means the storage access won't work as expected.
We've been working on adding additional checks to account for these corner cases but the correct approach is to feed an override for setting cookies like we did for [getting cookies](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5317989) so that the underlying restricted cookie manager can deal with these values.

entry.title: Device emulation doesn't affect the navigator.platform value
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open developer tools on any page an enable the device emulation. 2. Select some Android device, for example Moto G Power. 3. In the console, check that the navigator.platform value is no correct, it remains the original one for the host machine.
# Problem Description When emulating a certain device, the browser already adjusts a lot of different properties like: viewport dimensions, user agent and window.devicePixelRatio. It seems to me like the navigator.platform should also be affected, but it isn't.
I think the device emulation should mimic the target environment as closely as possible. Right now, I'm still getting "MacIntel" when emulating Android devices.
All that said, the main reason is a bit different to be honest. I have recently uncovered thousands of websites that target "navigator.platform == 'Linux x86_64'" to cheat performance metrics. They contain scripts that would bail from loading resources, inject LCP hacks or even call document.close() when seeing Linux x86_64. This is usually to fool PageSpeed Insights/GTmetrix and other performance testing tools in order to sell "performance optimisation" services.
My hope is that aligning the value of navigator.platform to the emulated device will stop existing cheats from being applied and make it harder to come up with new ones in the future.
I can see that the navigator.platform was already reduced as a part of this task https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40855169 which should theoretically make this work simpler(?).
# Summary Device emulation doesn't affect the navigator.platform value
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Disabling cookies might be broken with multi profile
entry.content: Developers can enable/disable cookies entirely in WebView with the [CookieManager#setAcceptCookie](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/CookieManager) API. This is ultimately fed to a [AwCookieAccessPolicy](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:android_webview/browser/aw_cookie_access_policy.h;drc=4dbc034a20d71ba93b61d60d1d26526d6d8cc1c1) singleton that doesn't seem to be associated with the AwBrowserContext so it probably isn't respecting the profile and is likely set to whatever was last configured.

entry.title: #search part of URI when opening a PDF document
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open any PDF document with #search in URI The search pattern is not highlighted 2. 3.
# Problem Description Hi Team,
We were using IE , Now migrated our app to chrome. We deal with lot of PDF and pass Search terms as part of URI. In IE there used to be a navigation pane with the search filter applied along with search terms highlighted. This was very helpful and reduced our work load of manually copying large numbers/string and search with ctrl+f. Since we use a lot of documents in our daily activities, these increases our work. Please can you support the feature of #search in chrome's inbuilt PDF viewer. Right now Mozilla supports it(Adobe pdf.js)
# Summary #search part of URI when opening a PDF document
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Tests are failing: ninja://chrome/test:browser\\_tests/%ExtensionPageCaptureApiTest.SaveAsMHTMLWithFileAccess%
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures with a test name like: ninja://chrome/test:browser\\_tests/%ExtensionPageCaptureApiTest.SaveAsMHTMLWithFileAccess%
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/6524e4fa121b45e6138259a85899241a
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Fuzzing corpus zips not being updated
entry.content:
As Brendon noted, `latest.zip` (and other zips) in the [corpus backup bucket](https://pantheon.corp.google.com/storage/browser/clusterfuzz-libfuzzer-backup/corpus/libfuzzer/boringssl_read_pem_fuzzer;tab=objects?prefix=&forceOnObjectsSortingFiltering=false) are not being updated.
If nothing else, this will make the fuzzing coverage dashboard show out of date results (e.g. not reflective of new fuzzers).

entry.title: --reset-results on web platform tests with variants does not create the correct -expected.txt files
entry.content:
If you have a CL with failing web platform tests that use the [variants feature](https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testharness.html#variants), then `run_web_tests.py` with `--reset-results` will not create the correct `-expected.txt` files. The correct files seem to have the filename of `testname_variantname-expected.txt`, and there should be one per variant. The created files are just `testname-expected.txt`, and there is only one. (It's not clear which variant was run to create that file.)
A sample of such variant-using and currently-failing tests can be found by patching in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318859. Patchset 5 shows the result of
``` ./third_party/blink/tools/run_web_tests.py -t Default --no-retry-failures --reset-results virtual/close-watcher/external/wpt/close-watcher ```
whereas patchset 6 shows the manually-created `-expected.txt` files that I am hopeful will pass CQ.

entry.title: Widevine Video renders incorrectly beyond certain container size
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. visit https://v.qq.com/x/cover/v2098lbuihuqs11/u00315w81xn.html (you probbaly need ip in China mainland) 2. click fullscreen or make page size large enough 3. video was rendered on top of every thing and not respecting zindex
# Problem Description The widevine content is rendered to an incorrect "layer" when content dimension beyond certain size. It also seems not directly caused by HTMLVideoElement since we only encountered this issue in this site.
Also this issue only found on Chrome 122, with widevine content. And element highlighting also prove that the video frame rendered is not actually "on" the video element, you can check the attached image
# Summary Widevine Video renders incorrectly beyond certain container size
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: error accessing java files from other packages to my custom application file
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. create a new java file at "org.chromium.chrome.browser.base/" which extends splitchromeapplication. update the appliation file in androidmanifest.xml 2. access java files from different package ex: "org.chromium.chrome.browser.tab" 3. compile using autoninja -C out/Release chrome_public_apk
# Problem Description I created a custom application java file which extends the SplitChromeApplication.java. this MyApplication file access java class from other package outside from its. own package. while doing so. it throws error while compiling . package does not exists.
error:
autoninja -C out/Release chrome_public_apk ninja: Entering directory `out/Release' [1/165] ACTION //chrome/android:base_module_java__compile_java(//build/toolchain/android:android_clang_arm64) FAILED: obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar.info python3 ../../build/android/gyp/compile_java.py --depfile=gen/chrome/android/base_module_java__compile_java.d --generated-dir=gen/chrome/android/base_module_java/generated_java --jar-path=obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.javac.jar --java-srcjars=\[\"gen/chrome/android/base_module_jni.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/chrome_product_config.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/base_module_java__assetres.srcjar\",\ \"gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.generated.srcjar\"\] --target-name //chrome/android:base_module_java__compile_java --classpath=@FileArg\(gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.build_config.json:android:sdk_interface_jars\) --header-jar obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.turbine.jar --classpath=\[\"obj/chrome/android/base_module_java.turbine.jar\"\] --classpath=@FileArg\(gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.build_config.json:deps_info:javac_full_interface_classpath\) --chromium-code=1 --jar-info-exclude-globs=\[\"\*/ProductConfig.class\",\ \"\*/R.class\",\ \"\*/R\\\$\*.class\",\ \"\*/Manifest.class\",\ \"\*/Manifest\\\$\*.class\",\ \"\*/\*GEN_JNI.class\"\] @gen/chrome/android/base_module_java.sources ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:3: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.utils does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.utils.PreferencesProvider; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:7: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth.AuthActivity; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:8: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.news does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.news.NewsActivity; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:9: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.policy does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.policy.PolicyDialog; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:10: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth.login does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.auth.login.LoginFragment; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:12: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.tabmodel.document does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.tabmodel.document.TabDelegate; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:13: error: cannot find symbol import org.chromium.content_public.browser.LoadUrlParams; ^ symbol: class LoadUrlParams location: package org.chromium.content_public.browser ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:14: error: package org.chromium.chrome.browser.tab does not exist import org.chromium.chrome.browser.tab.TabLaunchType; ^ ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:37: error: cannot find symbol PreferencesProvider.init( this ); ^ symbol: variable PreferencesProvider location: class MyApplication ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:45: error: cannot find symbol Intent intent = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), AuthActivity.class); ^ symbol: class AuthActivity location: class MyApplication ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:51: error: cannot find symbol Intent intent = new Intent(getApplicationContext(), NewsActivity.class); ^ symbol: class NewsActivity location: class MyApplication ../../chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/base/MyApplication.java:61: error: cannot find symbol new TabDelegate(false).createNewTab(new LoadUrlParams("chrome://newtab"), TabLaunchType.FROM_LINK, null); ^ symbol: class LoadUrlParams location: class MyApplication ../../chro
# Summary error accessing java files from other packages to my custom application file
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: YouTube controls are not visible after entering full screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.2 (Official Build) canary (arm64) ee77acc178bb8175e0f0b1967d1bd0bbcc9d5a82-refs/branch-heads/6312@{#6}
OS: Mac(11.4)
Feature Bug : https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326422875
Test Plan - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ED_otHAVJCpb_-5VqeO67F1673aHRO6HUwvQwxZOBjw/ ￼ Precondition : launching Chrome with --enable-features="ImmersiveFullscreen" #enable-immersive-fullscreen-toolbar from chrome://flags
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch Chrome and play a youtube video 2. Move the mouse focus in and out of video and observe that YouTube controls are seen when the mouse focus is on the video 3. Enter full screen 4. Try hovering the mouse over the video 5. Observe that the YouTube controls are not visible
Actual Result : YouTube controls are not visible after entering full screen
Expected Result : YouTube controls must be visible after entering full screen
Kindly refer the screencast below
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B0RRq4OYAbd62abc2TF0Xwbo4x3RtlZB/view?usp=drive_link
@bur : Could you please look into this.
Thanks!

entry.title: [Regression] - Unable to play videos in Netflix Observed "Pardon the interruption" error
entry.content:
Chrome Version: M124 Canary #124.0.6318.0/15794.0.0 on Osiris(Brya) device Lacros Version: LaCrOS Canary #124.0.6323.0 [lacros only] OS: Chrome
Details: 1)Accounts: Test account and Corp account 2)Enterprise Enrolled: yes, logged in with corp account 3)Devices: A)Non-Corp devices - Osiris,Redrix and kano(Brya) -x86/lacros64 Guybrush(Dewatt) - x86/lacros64 B)Corp devices: NA 4) Repro on Ash-chrome: yes Repro on LaCrOS: Yes, 5)Mode: Normal Mode 6)Frequency: Always. 7)Enable the following flags from Ash Chrome (legacy) #lacros-stability = Canary #lacros-only = Enabled #lacros-availability-ignore = Enabled
What steps will reproduce the problem?
Launch chrome, Enable LaCrOS Launch LaCrOS Browser, Navigate to Netflix site, Log in and try to play any movie or drama, Observed "Pardon the Interruption" error message with error code:C7361-1253. Attaching the listnr report: https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91586894388
Expected: Able to login to Netflix and play the video without any error. Actual: Observed "Pardon the Interruption" error message with error code: C7361-1253.
Note: Issue Able to reproduce on ash-chrome as well lacros
Able to reproduce the issue on lacros canary D-check 124.0.6322.1 using M124 Canary #124.0.6318.0/15794.0.0 on Guybrush(Dewatt) device - X86_arm 64
Issue seems to be Regression,as issue working fine in M111 stable 111.0.5563.152/15329.63.0 on lava(coral) device

entry.title: some compiler flag "-Wno-shadow" in gn files don't detected the compiler is msvc
entry.content:
some gn file add "-Wno-shadow" to cflags and cflags_cc I build some chroumium code by msvc-cl, but msvc can't recognise "-Wno-shadow", only gcc and clang recognise "-Wno-shadow".
maybe these cflags and cflags_cc can detected the compiler?
files:
thrid_parth/grpc/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/libjxl/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/libprotobuf-mutator/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/liburlpattern/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/maldoca/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/pffft/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/tflite/BUILD.gn thrid_parth/zxcvbn-cpp/BUILD.gn
